references.text: In our terminology, a CW laser is passively mode locked if the modelocked state, regardless of how it has been achieved, can be sustained by passive optical nonlinearities without any external control. Once the passive pulse shaping process is strong enough not only to sustain a steady-state pulse but also to make it evolve from free running (CW) oscillations, we call it self-starting passive mode locking. This redefinition of a well-known and widely used term has been necessary because self-sustaining passive mode locking does not necessarily imply self-starting with the novel class of CW solid-state lasers, unlike dye lasers.
